image.altText: Rohan Goyne in a blue-gray polo shirt with the collar turned up, sitting down and holding papers

props.synopsis: GP bulk billing rates in the ACT have declined since the pandemic, and federal government figures have cast doubt on whether a national target to bulk bill nine out of ten GP visits will be met.

title.children: Rohan struggles to pay GP bills. He's hoping that will change

image.altText: A Whole New Ballgame | David Pocock

props.synopsis: He became the ACT's first ever independent Senator three years ago, but David Pocock wants to keep 'doing politics differently'.

title.children: Pocock wants to force major parties to 'actually put Australians first'

image.altText: Brindabella Christian College sign.

props.synopsis: The troubled Brindabella Christian College will close one of its campuses from Friday next week, after it was put under voluntary administration last month.

title.children: Brindabella Christian College to close Charnwood campus after voluntary administration decision

image.altText: A graphic of the commemorative $1 coin, titled Swift and Sure.

props.synopsis: The Mint has released a $1 coin for the centenary of the Royal Australian Corps of Signals, complete with a secret encoded message.

title.children: Can you solve the code on this new $1 coin?

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: Independent Senator David Pocock accuses the Australian National University of misleading a Senate estimates committee over how much it paid to a consulting firm.

title.children: Pocock calls for inquiry into ANU leadership over $1 million contract

image.altText: ACT Chief Police Officer Scott Lee in the Belconnen Police Station

props.synopsis: ACT police say a trio of masked men orchestrated four targeted shootings in Canberra over a week, leaving one man with serious injuries and killing a pet dog.

title.children: One man injured and dog killed in spate of shootings across Canberra, police say

image.altText: Two police officers stand talking seriously on a road with cones on it.

props.synopsis: The principal of St Edmund's College in Canberra says two teenage boys who were allegedly hit by a stolen car on Friday morning outside the school are in serious but stable condition, and face "a long road to recovery".

title.children: Father of boy struck by allegedly stolen car helped save other teen, St Edmund's principal says

image.altText: A scenic shot shows the sloping hills of Norfolk Island

props.synopsis: Locals on tiny Norfolk Island have been left "scratching their heads" at the prospect of being slugged with tariffs by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: 'Poor old penguins': This tiny island doesn't know why Trump hit it with 29pc tariffs

image.altText: Anthony Albanese high fives a primary school students

props.synopsis: From tumbles to tariffs, both leaders attempted to rewrite history as the election campaign clocked up week one.

title.children: Albanese apologises to lost safe seat, Dutton digs into his own pocket

image.altText: Steph Catley dribbles the ball for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: The Matildas are not at full strength, but they will have hometown support on their side as they face South Korea in their friendly international in Sydney. Follow live.

title.children: Depleted Matildas face South Korea in opening friendly

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: How does Australia look against the South Koreans?

image.altText: Bailey Smith runs with the ball

props.synopsis: Geelong is seeking a bounce-back win against a Melbourne side desperate to get off the mark in 2025, but will have to do so without a key veteran who was ruled out late. Follow live.

title.children: Key Cat a late out as Geelong prepares for winless Demons

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mark Blicavs is a late out for Geelong
Collingwood's Dan Houston has been suspended for two games

image.altText: Viliami Vailea celebrates a try with Robert Derby during an NRL game against the Penrith Panthers.

props.synopsis: South Sydney takes on long-time rivals the Roosters after North Queensland hands Penrith a fourth straight loss with a gritty defensive effort. Follow live.

title.children: Panthers denied miraculous late try as Cowboys hang on for gutsy win

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 1' Latrell Mitchell is back as the Rabbitohs kick off against the Roosters
The Cowboys hang on and the Panthers lose their fourth in a row
JAXON PURDUE WITH THE TRY-SAVER!! A MATCH SAVER?

image.altText: Erin Phillips holds the ball in two hands as she prepares to kick the ball in a 2020 AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Dual sport star Erin Phillips won three AFLW Premierships and was a two-time WNBA champion. But her new biography describes the 'terrible' damage inflicted by skinfold tests and the Opals bodysuit uniform.

title.children: 'I hated my body': Erin Phillips opens up on body image issues

image.altText: Rehana Parvin in professional portrait

props.synopsis: Rehana Parvin, who was a mother-of-five, had travelled to her home country of Bangladesh with her teenage daughter on June last year. She disappeared about a month later.

title.children: AFP investigating suspected murder of Australian in Bangladesh

image.altText: Tony Mokbel walks from court.

props.synopsis: Victorian police figures express dismay after Tony Mokbel is granted bail by the state's highest court, offering the gangland figure his first taste of freedom in 18 years.

title.children: Victorian crime boss Tony Mokbel walks free on bail

image.altText: Man looking over his reading glasses

props.synopsis: Petro Georgiou held the seat of Kooyong in Melbourne's inner east for 16 years and was outspoken about the rights of immigrants and asylum seekers.

title.children: Former federal Liberal MP Petro Georgiou dies at 77

image.altText: A man with black hair and shaved sides, wearing a black jacket stands on a footpath looking at a black car driving past.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 23-year-old from Narre Warren with murder over the August 2023 shooting of Mohammed Keshtiar.

title.children: Man, 23, charged in Melbourne over murder of crime figure 'Afghan Ali'

image.altText: Sentinelese stand guard on the beach

props.synopsis: The Sentinelese are believed to be the last pre-Neolithic tribe in the world and have had very little contact with the outside world.

title.children: Who are the Sentinelese people and how have they stayed isolated for so long?

image.altText: A mosque, white in colour, with a police car and cops out the front of it.

props.synopsis: The 16-year-old boy, who cannot be legally identified, faced court in Bunbury over several posts on the Instagram page of a mosque in suburban Sydney.

title.children: Teen faces court over 'Christchurch 2.0' threat against Sydney mosque

image.altText: A truck stopped on a closed road.

props.synopsis: Police say a passer-by found the remains on the Victorian Highway at Kiata, which has been closed in both directions.

title.children: Human remains found on Victorian highway after possible hit and run

image.altText: A large open cut mine viewed through a fence from a higher vantage point.

props.synopsis: Sleepless nights and irritated eyes and lungs — this is what residents say they're living with beside one of the world's largest lithium mines.

title.children: Residents vow to step up dust battle against multinational lithium miner

image.altText: John Howard head and shoulders shot speaking while standing in front of an Australian flag. He wears a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard says defence should never be used as a bargaining chip in negotiating exemptions from US President Donald Trump's tariffs.

title.children: Don't use defence to negotiate on tariffs, former PM Howard warns

image.altText: A middle aged white woman tinted blue and an  old white man tinted yellow

props.synopsis: Like their name suggests, an independent MP is separate from any party, with their own individual policies and views. Here's a guide to who's who.

title.children: The independents running at the 2025 election, and what they stand for

image.altText: woman reading book in bed

props.synopsis: Experts say the clocks turning back an hour this Sunday is good news for our sleep.

title.children: How the end of daylight saving could improve your sleep

image.altText: A man stands smiling at the camera with a bird perched on each hand in front of him.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death of man struck by cars on the M1 after a police pursuit hears from the officers involved, and from family members who say his death has left "a gaping hole" in their home.

title.children: Road spikes 'appropriate' before fleeing driver's death, inquest told

image.altText: Gina Rinehart speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: The mining magnate confirms a disagreement with the federal opposition leader over Dutton's gas reservation plan, but says the "beauty of the non-left-side" of politics is people can disagree on issues at times and "still remain good friends".

title.children: Gina Rinehart and Peter Dutton confirm rift over gas policy

image.altText: A young man wearing a baseball cap looks down at his phone

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering Indigenous teenager Cassius Turvey mocked the schoolboy in a phone call hours after fatally attacking him, the WA Supreme Court has been told.

title.children: Cassius Turvey 'mocked' hours after alleged attack, court hears

image.altText: A family walks down a dock.

props.synopsis: Plus, Cassie Workman gets witchy with Lilly Wachowski and Baby Reindeer leads the BAFTAs sweep.

title.children: White Lotus composer ditches series, dishes on creator Mike White

image.altText: a middle-aged male politician wearing a suit speaking at a lectern

props.synopsis: The Albanese government will ramp up the mining and processing of critical minerals under a new proposal that could be used as a bargaining chip in negotiations with the United States to ease tariffs on Australia.

title.children: Albanese plans to turn Australia into critical minerals key player in face of Trump's tariffs

image.altText: Anthony Albanese drinks a coffee in a cafe

props.synopsis: Small businesses will get a 12-month reprieve and be able to instantly write off another $20,000 in expenses, if Labor wins next month's federal election.

title.children: Albanese targets cafes and tradies in instant asset write-off

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: Health practitioners will now have proven findings of sexual misconduct permanently listed on their public registration, giving patients the ability to make more informed choices about who they seek care from.

title.children: Sexual misconduct findings to be permanently listed on doctor registrations

image.altText: Two men and a woman enjoy a barbecue on the verandah or a home in the country.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's internal pollster is helping orchestrate a campaign to boost public support for the gas industry ahead of the federal election in what has been described as "textbook astroturfing".

title.children: 'Textbook astroturfing': Coalition pollster working with gas campaign

image.altText: The tower with a banner reads "lucky topping out".

props.synopsis: As Beijing silences mentions of the skyscraper building that collapsed in Bangkok, the Chinese company involved in the project faces mounting scrutiny in Thailand.

title.children: Beijing censors news of Chinese-built tower's collapse in Bangkok

image.altText: A man in suit waving South Korean national flag.

props.synopsis: President of South Korea Yoon Suk Yeol is officially out of office, and the country will head back to the polls, after the Constitutional Court ruled to uphold his impeachment.

title.children: Korean president's downfall complete after court ousts him from office

image.altText: Two people in winter jackets speaking in front of microphones outdoors in a snowy setting.

props.synopsis: During a visit to Greenland, Mette Frederiksen dismisses the Trump administration's desire to annex the semi-autonomous Danish territory.

title.children: Danish PM sends firm message to Trump on visit to Greenland
